programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Shoes First!" - In a challenge for Marie Claire, the designers are taken to the infamous Marie Claire shoe closet and given the challenge of designing an outfit inspired by a pair of shoes. But in order to get their shoes, they must compete against each other in a fashion trivia contest.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Having a Field Day" - Heidi challenges the designers to create performance wear that is also fashionable for her New Balance collection. But first, the designers must participate in an obstacle course to see who gets an extra hour in the workroom and first dibs on fabric.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Let's Do Brunch" - The designers are treated to a beautiful Southern brunch in the city. However, their relaxing is cut short as Tim arrives and explains that their challenge is to design a look for the Modern Southern woman—or, the Belk customer. After a challenging runway, the judges send the bottom three designers back to the drawing board, where they have one hour to rework their looks and save themselves from elimination. Ultimately two designers win the challenge, and one is out.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Project Runway Superfan!" - Through the help of L'Oreal Paris, the designers are given the opportunity to make over "Superfans" of Project Runway. Also, tensions run high as two designers engage in a heated conflict, and Tim has to intervene.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Next Generation" - For the HP Challenge the designers must create a textile and look based on inspirations they receive from Next Generation Innovators. When the judges are not pleased on the Runway, two designers are eliminated.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Butterfly Effect" - For the L'Oreal Makeup Challenge, the designers are asked to create an avant-garde look inspired by butterflies. But there is a twist: They also have to redesign a previously loosing look from the season, as the judges prepare to decide who makes it to New York Fashion Week.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Finale Part 1" - Fashion Week is just around the corner, and the remaining five designers return home to work on their collections. But even though two designers are guaranteed a spot at New York Fashion Week, the remaining three have to battle in front of the judges to prove who has what it takes to make it to the next level and show their collection at Lincoln Center.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Finale Part 2" - The moment that our designers have been waiting and hoping for since the very beginning, the opportunity to show at New York Fashion Week, has finally arrived. With only four competitors remaining, another look to create, and very little time left, who will ultimately have what it takes to win Project Runway?

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Reunion Special " - All of the designers reunite one last time to discuss their experiences on Project Runway together, settle any last feuds that still exist in the group, and reminisce about their time on this season. Tim Gunn hosts...and a rather spirited discussion leads him to almost lose his cool with the designers!

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Road to the Runway" - Tim Gunn introduces everyone to the eighteen new designers who will be competing against each other on Project Runway Season 13. He also teases the fact that one of three former designers, chosen strictly by the fans, will be rejoining the competition this season.

programme.title: Friday Night In with The Morgans: Episode 2
programme.desc: The Morgans check in with their friends Sarah Wayne Callies, Michael Cudlitz, a farmer from their local community, plus a viewer at home, all appearing via video chat.

programme.title: Twice as Far
programme.desc: Two different groups leave Alexandria on supply runs. While both are concerned with the future of the community, immediate danger will derail them.

programme.title: Talking Dead on "Twice as Far"
programme.desc: Josh McDermitt & Christian Serratos discuss the episode, "Twice as Far," from the hit show The Walking Dead. Host Chris Hardwick.

programme.title: Ouroboros
programme.desc: Madison confronts Strand about his mysterious destination. Nick, Alicia, and others inspect wreckage from a plane crash.

programme.title: Talking Dead: Fear the Walking Dead 203
programme.desc: Cast & guests discuss the latest episode of the hit show, Fear The Walking Dead. Hosted by Chris Hardwick.

programme.title: California: Pacific Coast Highway
programme.desc: On this ride up the PCH, Norman and his friend Imogen check out some beach dune buggies, ride the bike of the future and drop in on a podcast.

programme.title: On Location of Fear the Walking Dead V2
programme.desc: Get a behind the scenes look at the locations used on the first three seasons of Fear the Walking Dead.

programme.title: Friday Night In with The Morgans: Episode 2
programme.desc: The Morgans check in with their friends Sarah Wayne Callies, Michael Cudlitz, a farmer from their local community, plus a viewer at home, all appearing via video chat.

programme.title: Twice as Far
programme.desc: Two different groups leave Alexandria on supply runs. While both are concerned with the future of the community, immediate danger will derail them.

programme.title: Brother's Keeper
programme.desc: As Nick and Jake set out to handle a delicate situation, the Ranch prepares for a threat greater than any they've faced before.

programme.title: This Land Is Your Land
programme.desc: With the Ranchers trapped and without hope, Alicia is thrust into a position of leadership where she's forced to make life-changing decisions.

programme.title: Jane White is Sick and Twisted
programme.desc: Jane White (Kim Little) is a disturbed young woman living in her own bizarre TV fantasy land. For Jane, life itself is a television program, and she dreams of becoming a star on the small screen. Convincing herself that Gerry King (David L. Lander), a popular talk show host, is her birth father, she sets out on an adventurous road trip -- aided by her equally looney boyfriend, Dick (Wil Wheaton) -- to confront her "father" on the air, and, just maybe, make a splash on reality television.

programme.title: Mega Shark vs Giant Octopus
programme.desc: Strange things are afoot in the depths of the sea. First a passenger plane vanishes over the Pacific Ocean. Then an oil platform is obliterated. Marine biologist Emma MacNeil (Deborah Gibson) is dispatched to investigate the phenomena, and, with the help of Japanese scientist Seiji Shimada (Vic Chao), she makes a discovery that will rock the world: An enormous prehistoric shark and a giant octopus have been awakened from their icy slumbers -- and they're hungry.

programme.title: Merlin and the War of the Dragons
programme.desc: Before growing into the legendary adviser to the Pendragons, a youthful Merlin spends his days studying with the Mage (Jürgen Prochnow), a master sorcerer, and honing his magical skills. When a fellow apprentice sorcerer, Hengest (Iago McGuire), grows jealous of Merlin's rapid progress, he rebels against their mutual mentor and betrays King Vortigen (Hefin Wyn) to Saxon invaders. As Hengest conjures an army of dragons, Merlin prepares to test his developing abilities in battle.

programme.title: Lord of the Elves
programme.desc: In an ancient age, the peace-loving Hobbits are enslaved by the Java Men, a race of flesh-eating dragon-riders. The young Hobbit Goben must join forces with their neighbor giants, the humans, to free his people and vanquish their enemies.

programme.title: Sinbad And The War Of The Furies
programme.desc: On a treasure hunt gone wrong, modern-day adventurer Sinbad accidentally releases the Furies, three beautiful but terrible ancient beings powerful enough to threaten life on Earth.

programme.title: Sinister Squad
programme.desc: When a violent supernatural cult known as Death's Messengers reigns terror on Earth, a team of malevolent storybook villains is coerced into fighting in the modern world, but these baddies must learn to keep their true wickedness at bay if they want any chance at freedom.

programme.title: Psychic Investigators, S1 E1 | Jason Williams
programme.desc: Psychic Sue Evans assists the family of a man who never made it home after a night out drinking with his buddies.

programme.title: Psychic Investigators, S1 E2 | Amie Hoffman
programme.desc: Psychic Nancy Weber is called in by the family of teen Amie Hoffman, who disappeared on the way home from work. Then, after another young woman is murdered, the police work together with Weber to track down the serial killer.

programme.title: Psychic Investigators, S1 E3 | Margie Calciano
programme.desc: Psychic Lauren Thibodeau helps a police detective with a cold case, leading him to a killer now several states away from the scene of the crime.

programme.title: Psychic Investigators, S1 E4 | Rachel Domas
programme.desc: Veteran psychic Nancy Weber assists a rookie cop in solving the case of a 14-year-old girl who missed the school bus and was never seen again.

programme.title: Psychic Investigators, S1 E5 | Alexis Burke
programme.desc: Psychic Laurie McQuary helps Oregon detective Robert Lee identify a missing-persons case as a murder.

programme.title: Psychic Investigators, S1 E6 | Penney Serra
programme.desc: Police consult psychic and time walker Mary Pascarella Downey after leads grow cold in the case of a young woman brutally murdered in a parking garage.

programme.title: Phenomenon: The Lost Archives, S1 E1 | Irretrievably Lost: The Search for the Savannah Warhead
programme.desc: Recently-released government documents indicate that within the past 50 years, American military operations have been responsible for the disappearance of 12 atomic weapons.

programme.title: Phenomenon: The Lost Archives, S1 E2 | Up for Sale
programme.desc: Take a closer look at the launch of Sputnik, the unpaid workers, and the mass exodus of Russian rocket scientists to unfriendly nations interested in developing weapons of mass destruction.

programme.title: Phenomenon: The Lost Archives, S1 E3 | H.A.A.R.P.: Holes in Heaven?
programme.desc: The brainchild of controversial Nikola Tesla, High-Frequency Active Aural Research Project (H.A.A.R.P.) is a combined effort of the Air Force and Navy ostensibly designed to influence the weather.

programme.title: Would You Believe It?, S1 E7 | The Bones of 'Mad' Anthony Wayne
programme.desc: We explore the stories of a Revolutionary War general who received an unusual burial, the sprawling history of ice cream, and a town in Southern California that is the center of the world.

programme.title: Would You Believe It?, S1 E8 | The Johnstown Flood
programme.desc: We explore the stories of one of the deadliest disasters in American history, as well as an elephant-shaped building and its interesting history on a seaside town.

programme.title: Would You Believe It?, S1 E9 | The Liberty Bell
programme.desc: We explore the stories of how a 14-year-old farm boy invented television and went to court to prove it, as well as how the Liberty Bell came to develop its crack.

programme.title: Would You Believe It?, S1 E10 | Turkey Tracks
programme.desc: We explore a Connecticut town that claims to have dinosaur tracks, a museum of smugglers and their methods of smuggling, and the story of an artist who uses all types of wood to make his dream home.

programme.title: Would You Believe It?, S1 E11 | The Brookdale Inn
programme.desc: We explore the stories of a small town named after a sports star who had never been to it, and a British couple who strive to recreate the 1940s in their home life.

programme.desc: An aspiring novelist unexpectedly finds the love of her life onboard a holiday cruise.

programme.title: The Island with Bear Grylls
programme.desc: "Episode 2" - Bear Grylls abandons 14 ordinary British women on a remote, uninhabited pacific island, left with just the clothes they stand up in and a few basic tools. They're given no food and just a day's supply of drinking water. Like their counterparts on the male island, these women will be utterly alone for six weeks, left to film everything themselves. So when stripped of the luxuries and conveniences of 21stcentury living will these women have the skills and mental strength to survive and rival the male islanders?

programme.title: Lucky Dog
programme.desc: ''Kai'' - Love is blind--- especially when it comes to adorable Papillion mix, Kai. Brandon thinks Kai has what it takes to become a therapy dog, but first he'll need to teach Kai how to see and experience the world in a whole new way.

programme.title: Lucky Dog

programme.title: G Herbo Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: G Herbo goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Stadium Goods in New York City and talks about how he used to clean sneakers growing up, camping out for shoes, and why he loves Air Force 1s so much.

programme.title: How to Cook a Double-Dipped Roast Beef Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: The double-dipped roast beef burger is an icon of Brooklyn, New York, and Burger Scholar George Motz is here to teach you how to make one at home. This regional one-off burger-known locally as the "Gargiulo"- hails from the historic roast-beef emporium Brennan & Carr. Here, the burger patty is topped with freshly sliced roast beef, sauteed onions, American cheese, and is eventually dunked in a vat of piping hot beef broth.

programme.title: How to Cook a Perfect Steakhouse Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz usually smashes his patties with childlike glee. But today, he has his eyes set on a different prize: the luxurious, thick, dry-aged steakhouse burger! The beauty of this style is its lack of adornments-a juicy patty, cheese, and a sturdy bun, which all help emphasize the beef. In the words of Motz: "Take the upgrade people!" Without further ado, learn how to cook a perfect steakhouse burger at home!

programme.title: How to Cook a Loose Meat Sandwich with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Here's a weird one for you-the Loose Meat Sandwich from the Midwest. Is it a hamburger? We're not entirely sure. Is it amazing? Hell yes! Think of a Sloppy Joe, minus the slop. If you close your eyes and bite into a loose meat sandwich, you taste all the elements of a hamburger: bun, beef, seasoning, mustard, onion, pickle. And now it's George's job to bring this Midwest icon into your home.

programme.title: How to Cook a Mississippi Slugburger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz teaches you how to cook a hyper-regional slugburger from Northern Mississippi. Borne out of the Great Depression, the slugburger patty combines beef and bread crumbs-a method that was used to extend the meat supply. As the bread crumbs toast on the griddle, they absorb the rendered beef fat, creating the ultimate crispy burger. Here is your master class on how to make a regional slugburger at home.

programme.title: How to Cook a Texas-Style Smoked Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz has taught us about fried burgers and steamed burgers, but did you know about the smoked burger from Texas? In this episode, George teaches you how to apply the principles of barbecue to a burger. With a simple offset smoker set-up, you can achieve the perfect smoke ring on this burger right in your own backyard. Here is your master class on the Texas smoked burger.

programme.title: How to Cook a Hawaiian Loco Moco Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz is here to set the record straight: A real homegrown Hawaiian burger is NOT a beef patty topped with pineapple and ham. When locals crave a burger, they order something called the loco moco. Technically a 'burger plate,' this regional icon is a burger patty placed on a bed of rice, drenched in gravy, and topped with a fried egg. A popular late-night order at diners, the loco moco is one of George's favorite burgers to eat. And now's your chance to make one at home.

programme.title: How to Cook a Deep-Fried Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: In our season finale, Burger Scholar George Motz teaches you how to cook a regional specialty from Tennessee: The deep-fried burger! At a place called Dyer's in Memphis, burgers are smashed paper thin and dipped in a skillet filled with hot beef tallow-a method that harkens back to the dawn of the original hamburger. Grease is an heirloom at Dyer's. When you bite into a burger from there, you're biting into history. That's because the same grease has been used since 1912!

programme.title: How to Cook a Perfect Patty Melt with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz teaches you how to cook his favorite patty melt! Motz says this is the burger he dreams about all the time, and you'll quickly learn why it's so unique. Borrowing a method from Wisconsin burger shacks, Motz poaches the hamburger patty in beef stock and slides it in between a grilled cheese. This is truly regional hamburger nirvana.

programme.title: How to Cook a Perfect Double Cheeseburger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz teaches you how to cook one of the most important hamburgers in America-the original double cheeseburger from Southern California's iconic Bob's Big Boy Restaurant. This is the double burger that birthed all other double burgers (and even predates the invention of the Big Mac by almost 30 years!). Learn how to make a perfect double cheeseburger at home while soaking up some hamburger history.

programme.title: How to Cook 2 Regional Fast-Food Burgers with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz is taking you on a ride through regional American fast-food burger history! A lot of the big, commercial fast-food places have given the hamburger a bad wrap. Which is why George wants to set the record straight and show you two family-owned, hyper-regional burger chains that still do it right-Swensons in Ohio, and Fat Mo's in Tennessee. These beloved burgers are highly unique, and take a few twists and turns to get to the finished product.

programme.title: How to Cook a Spicy Malaysian Egg Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: In this special episode of Burger Scholar Sessions, George Motz pulls back the curtain on an international street-food icon: the spicy Malaysian egg burger! This burger is so famous that it goes by several names-the Ramly Burger, the Sloppy Burger, and the "Sampah" Burger, which translates to "rubbish" in Malaysia. But this burger isn't rubbish at all it's a total flavor bomb. Wrapped in an egg and covered with spices, it's one of the craziest burgers George has ever tried.

programme.title: Lorde Drops the Mic While Eating Spicy Wings | Hot Ones
programme.desc: Lorde is a two-time Grammy Award-winning singer-songwriter, and she's back with her much-anticipated third studio album, Solar Power. The latest single, "Stoned at the Nail Salon," is out now, and there's a multi-continent tour set to begin next year. But how is she with spicy food? Find out as the New Zealand pop powerhouse takes on the wings of death and discusses the sound of cicadas, the art of songwriting, and the keys to a perfect onion ring

programme.title: Sean Evans and Mike Chen Taste Test Spicy Ice Cream (Feat. The Crazy Gorilla) | Coneheads
programme.desc: Fire and ice are polar opposites of one another. But what if these awesome forces of nature were combined into one incredibly delicious frozen treat? In this episode of Coneheads, Mike Chen teams up with Hot Ones host Sean Evans for a deep dive into the perplexing yet magical world of spicy ice cream.

programme.title: Quavo Is Stunned by Spicy Wings | Hot Ones
programme.desc: Quavo is a rapper, songwriter, and record producer you know as one-third of the rap group Migos. The latest single, "Straightenin," is out now with the group's upcoming fourth studio album Culture III set to release on June 11th. But how is he with spicy food? Find out as Quavo follows in the footsteps of Offset and attempts to scale the heights of Mount Scoville, discussing everything from Jeff Goldblum fits, to studio sessions with DJ Khaled, to partying with Elon Musk along the way.

programme.title: Elijah Wood Tastes the Lava of Mount Doom While Eating Spicy Wings | Hot Ones
programme.desc: Elijah Wood has been in more than 60 films over the course of his more than 30-year acting career-from Academy Award-winning indies, to one of the highest-grossing box office film franchises of all time in Lord of the Rings. His latest project is No Man of God, which is set to release in theaters and On Demand August 27th. But how is he with spicy food? An impromptu tasting at the Complex offices last year didn't bode well, but now Elijah is back for revenge in the Season 15 finale.

programme.title: Elizabeth Olsen Feels Brave While Eating Spicy Wings | Hot Ones
programme.desc: Elizabeth Olsen is an actress whose work includes everything from the theater, to acclaimed indies like Wind River and Ingrid Goes West, to the Marvel Cinematic Universe and the megahit show WandaVision, which is currently streaming on Disney+. But how is she with spicy food? Find out as Olsen takes on the wings of death and discusses WandaVision easter eggs, Comic-Con, the definition of "stan," and much more!

programme.title: David Harbour Feels Out of Control While Eating Spicy Wings | Hot Ones
programme.desc: David Harbour is an Emmy- and Tony Award-nominated actor perhaps best known for his portrayal of Jim Hopper in the Netflix megahit series Stranger Things. His latest is the highly anticipated Marvel Studios action spy thriller Black Widow, which is set to hit theaters and Disney+ Premiere Access on July 9th. But how is he with spicy food? Find out as Harbour takes on the wings of death and discusses everything from Shakespeare, to penguins, underground poker clubs.

programme.title: Ed Sheeran Tries to Avoid Failure While Eating Spicy Wings | Hot Ones
programme.desc: Ed Sheeran is a four-time Grammy Award-winning singer-songwriter, who has sold more concert tickets and albums than just about any other musician in history. His latest single, "Bad Habits," is out now, and there's a new album on the way. But how is he with spicy food? Find out as Teddy takes on the wings of death and chats about everything from salvaging Eric Clapton's guitar from a fire, to collaborating with Eminem and 50 Cent, to the time he brought Courteney Cox to Tesco.

programme.title: Mike Chen and Keith From the Try Guys Taste Test Ice Cream Truck Classics | Coneheads
programme.desc: Keith Habersberger is a legend when it comes to eating on the Internet. You've seen Keith stuff himself silly on his series Eat The Menu, but for the first time ever the Try Guys' resident taste-tester is teaming up with his friend Mike Chen to sample all of the classic ice cream truck treats he can get his hands on.

programme.title: Jack Harlow Returns to the Studio to Eat Spicy Wings | Hot Ones
programme.desc: Jack Harlow is a Grammy-nominated rapper and founder of the music collective Private Garden. Check out his debut studio album, "That's What They All Say," which is certified GOLD and available now. For the Season 15 premiere, he fulfills his teenage dream of sitting across from Sean Evans IN THE STUDIO and taking on the wings of death. Along the way, Harlow discusses his Louisville roots, his love of ranch, and the art of the ad-lib.

programme.title: Matt Damon Sweats From His Scalp While Eating Spicy Wings | Hot Ones
programme.desc: Matt Damon is an Academy Award-winning actor who has been in some of the most iconic films of the past 25 years-from Good Will Hunting to Saving Private Ryan, to the Bourne film series and many more. His latest is the Tom McCarthy-directed crime drama, Stillwater, which is out now. But how is he with spicy food? Find out as Damon takes on the wings of death and discusses his vast filmography, his love for Bill Burr, and his showdown with Phil Jackson at the 2008 NBA Finals.

programme.title: Kamaru Usman Goes to the Mat Against Spicy Wings | Hot Ones
programme.desc: Kamaru Usman is one of the best pound-for-pound fighters in the UFC-a dominant and reigning Welterweight Champion who has defended that title on four straight occasions. But how is he with spicy wings? Find out as the "Nigerian Nightmare" tries to put the wings of death in a chokehold while discussing fellow fighters like Francis Ngannou, breaking down the secrets of "sweet spots," and explaining the global appeal of Burna Boy.

programme.title: Oy Vey! My Son Is Gay!
programme.desc: Oy Vey! My Son Is Gay! is the story of the Hirsch's, a Jewish family living in the North Shore of Long Island, where every Friday night Shirley Hirsch (Lainie Kazan) invites another "perfect" girl for Shabbat dinner in hopes that her son, Nelson (John Lloyd Young), will marry a nice Jewish girl. When Shirley and Martin (Saul Rubinek) once again set him up on a date, Nelson reveals that he is already seeing someone. Shirley and Martin are thrilled and can't wait to meet the lucky lady. Nelson finally breaks the news to his parents that he is gay. At first, Shirley and Martin are confused and distraught, but when the reality starts to set in they begin to blame one another for Nelson's sexuality.

programme.title: Barbelle
programme.desc: S1 E1-3 | Alice and Veronica attempt to tell band manager Karen that they've broken up - as a band and a couple. They quickly learn that breaking up is not an option. Alice and Veronica start work on their second album. Band manager Karen introduces a new collaborator: the former CB3 child star turned pop starlet Lulu St. Claire. programme.desc: A married couple decided to escape the cold of winter with a mini-vacation in Key West. The wife went missing, and police searched every square inch of the island, they found nothing but a pair of sandals which might have belonged to her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mother of two young children was found dead in her bedroom. Her death was ruled a suicide - but when investigators learned she had almost died in a house fire three years earlier, they decided to take another look at the evidence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Bombings are difficult to solve, because the perpetrator isn't usually at the scene, and the evidence goes up in smoke. In this case pieces of plastic the size of grains of sand hold the key to a man's murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The wife of an Air Force officer was found dead in her bed with a plastic laundry bag near her face. Further investigation proved that the scene had been staged. Her death wasn't an accident, it was cold-blooded murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a fire destroyed most of a home and a young boy went missing, police organized the largest search in the history of their small town. First the boy's backpack was discovered five miles from home, and then his body was found 50 miles away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: highway patrolman was dispatched to what he thought would be a routine traffic accident until he looked in the car. While he had no formal training in forensic science, he had seen hundreds of accidents - but never as much blood as this.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A behavioral profile caused the Baton Rouge Police Department to search for the wrong man. They might not have made an arrest had it not been for a DNA picture of the suspect painted by a molecular biologist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An obstetrician returned home from the hospital and found his wife on the bathroom floor. She was covered with blood and not breathing. He tried unsuccessfully to revive her, staining his clothes with her blood in the process, and then he called 911.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Modesto, California teenager went missing. There was no sign of a struggle in her home, and police suspected she'd simply run away until her naked, bruised body was discovered in a ditch 20 miles away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Emergency dispatch received a call from a man who said his girlfriend shot and killed herself. The autopsy revealed that the gunshot wound was not self-inflicted and the evidence on her body would give police a golden opportunity to catch her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Native American woman was brutally killed in the desert of New Mexico, and the crime scene was rich in forensic evidence: tire tracks, shoe impressions and even the murder weapons.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A brilliant young architect became ill and died just before she was to testify in a criminal trial. The autopsy revealed she'd been poisoned with arsenic. Investigators had to determine which person who knew her had a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An employee of a dry cleaner was raped and murdered in the store. Police turned to forensic science for the answers they needed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young woman disappeared, police feared she was the latest victim in a string of similar crimes. A pair of bloody gloves, unique tire tracks, and ordinary grass and pine needles provided investigators with some extraordinary clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A college student was found dead, and the evidence suggested he knew his killer. Three hairs and some microscopic cells helped police to unravel a web of lies, and find the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In an affluent suburb of Philadelphia, police were called to the scene of what appeared to be an accidental drowning. The investigation gradually focused on one person, a suspect who had more than a million reasons to want the victim dead.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman was found dead on a golf course in the Bahamas. The grass on that course was so distinctive, it had evidentiary value. The evidence led police to two suspects. Each blamed the other, and they had to find out who the killer was.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teenager went missing after an evening of horseback riding. Her body was found a month later, three miles from her home. The killer unknowingly left trace evidence behind - tiny but unmistakable clues which pointed to him and him alone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Stand by for foam-padded action. It's another high-octane, low-pain-threshold edition of crazed knockabout game show Total Wipeout. Richard Hammond, as your host, will be arching an eyebrow at the ludicrous antics of 20 more over-excited contestants, who have thrown caution to the wind on Argentina's famous Total Wipeout course.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard Hammond and co-host Amanda Byram return to guide 20 foolhardy Brits through the biggest and daftest obstacle course in the universe. From giant hammers that smack them in the face, to the Shapeshifter and the Big Red Balls, each contestant braves the Qualifier to try and qualify for Double Cross.

programme.title: The Almost Impossible Gameshow
programme.desc: The aim of the game is to complete five challenges without losing all their lives. Challenges tonight include Cream Fling and Yum Yum Rum.

programme.title: Total Wipeout

There is a cash prize waiting for the winner, plus a shiny trophy, a lifetime of amusing anecdotes, and a nickname from host Richard Hammond.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Total Wipeout, the biggest, brashest and most exhausting game show on television, is back for more bangs, bumps, and bruises. This episode sees the return of the finalists from across the series as they compete for the ultimate title, 'Champions of Champions'. They pit themselves against some of the hardest obstacles we've ever witnessed on their journey to get to the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard Hammond dons his tuxedo for a special program honoring the heroes of Total Wipeout's fifth series. programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Prepping meals at home is cheaper and way more nutritious! Frankie makes portable breakfasts for the work week and forays into the stuffed dough of different cultures.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Who knew potatoes are not only affordable, but nutrient rich? Frankie is cookin’ up 3 potato dishes that are guaranteed to fill you up, and later a trio of delicious pancakes with a surprising twist.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: You say hotdishes, Frankie says casserole. Either way, these one-pot hotdishes are an affordable way to feed a group of people, or the family for dinner. Plus they're great to freeze for future meals. Frankie's secret is to use a combination of frozen and fresh ingredients to keep these hotdishes nutritious and cost-effective.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: You don't have to travel half way around the world to try a different cuisine - Italian and Filipino foods are accessible right here, right now.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Cauliflower is a star and can be transformed into unexpected dishes. Plus it's delicious and nutritious! Frankie reminds us to buy dried-goods in bulk and makes a big chuck roast that stretches over three dishes.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Dried beans are the most affordable and healthy way to prepare them, with very little effort to boot. Frankie will teach the basics of preparing beans from scratch while making super tasty recipes. We also take a field trip to the grocery store to shop the bulk aisle where those dried beans live. Beans are the gift that keeps on giving, so don’t be scared to eat too many. Remember, they’re good for your heart.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Frankie makes street food at home. It's fresher, healthier, and cheaper! Then - get ready! - because you've never seen rice like this before.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Frankie figured out the weekly budget grocery equation so you don’t have to. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner for seven days, for a family of four, for under $150. All it takes is a little planning, meal prep, and using up leftovers in inventive ways to avoid food waste.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Keep your pantry stocked with a few basic staples, and you’ll always have ingredients on hand for dinner, especially for pasta night. In this episode, Frankie creates delicious pasta dishes with the kitchen’s best-kept secret weapon – the pantry.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Frankie throws a game day party for under $25. Game days aren’t for dinner parties but they are a day for some fan-favorite finger foods, especially those you can make in advance. Frankie makes three no-fuss appetizers that are cheaper, healthier, and tastier than subpar game day take out. Plus it’s an easy and affordable party to host. So gather around with friends and cheer on your favorite teams. Or just eat. Both are a win.

programme.title: Southern Specialties
programme.desc: Hosts Bridget Lancaster and Julia Collin Davison cook up a Southern specialty-Tennessee Pulled Turkey Sandwiches. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reviews paper towels. Next, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of extra-sharp cheddar cheese. And finally, test cook Bryan Roof shows Bridget a regional recipe for Eastern North Carolina Fish Stew.

programme.title: Holiday Roast and Potatoes
programme.desc: Hosts Bridget Lancaster and Julia Collin Davison streamline a classic recipe for Boneless Rib Roast with Yorkshire Pudding and Jus. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of black tea. And finally, test cook Ashley Moore makes Bridget a family-favorite recipe for Lighthouse Inn Potatoes.

programme.title: Kebabs and Rice
programme.desc: Host Julia Collin Davison uncovers the secrets to making the best grilled shrimp and vegetable kebabs. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Bridget Lancaster to a tasting of whole-milk Greek yogurt. Finally, test cook Dan Souza shows Julia how to make Persian-style rice with a crispy, golden crust.

programme.title: Pantry Pastas
programme.desc: Host Bridget Lancaster uncovers the secrets for making perfect Pasta e Ceci. Next, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Julia Collin Davison to a tasting of parmesan. Then, science expert Dan Souza reveals the science behind parmesan's signature flavor. Finally, test cook Elle Simone shows Bridget how to make the ultimate Penne Arrabbiata.

programme.title: Pressure Cooker Perfection
programme.desc: Test cook Becky Hays makes host Julia Collin Davison the fastest-ever Farmhouse Chicken Noodle Soup in the pressure cooker. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Bridget Lancaster to a tasting of Gruyere. Next, science expert Dan Souza reveals the science behind pressure cookers. Finally, test cook Elle Simone makes Bridget the perfect Pressure-Cooker Pot Roast.

programme.title: Elegant Desserts
programme.desc: Hosts Julia Collin Davison and Bridget Lancaster uncover the secrets to the most decadent bar cookie recipe-Millionaire's Shortbread. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for serrated knives. Finally, test cook Elle Simone makes Bridget the ultimate Gateau Breton with Apricot Filling.

programme.title: Weeknight Italian
programme.desc: Test cook Dan Souza makes Bridget the quickest One-Hour Pizza. Equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for baking stones and steels, and gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews under-appliance dusters. Then, Julia and test cook Elle Simone unlock the secrets to the ultimate Beef Short Rib Ragu.

programme.title: Roast Chicken and Sprouts
programme.desc: In this episode, Julia and Bridget unlock the secrets to the ultimate Roast Chicken with Warm Bread Salad. Next, tasting expert Jack Bishop conducts a tasting of white miso. Finally, test cook Elle Simone teaches Bridget how to make foolproof Skillet-Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Chile, Peanuts, and Mint.

programme.title: Fried Rice and Kung Pao Shrimp
programme.desc: We show you how to prepare fried rice and kung pao shrimp. Our findings about rice cookers and long-grain white rice guarantee perfect rice every time.

programme.title: Texas Chili
programme.desc: We traveled to chili country, cooked with various experts in their kitchens, and tried out dozens of recipes in the test kitchen. We wanted a chili that would be hearty, heavy on the meat, and spicy but not overwhelmingly hot.

programme.title: Tea Time
programme.desc: In the test kitchen, we think afternoon (or morning) tea is an excellent excuse to whip up a batch of scones or a golden loaf of lemon pound cake. Making these baked goods at home certainly yields better results than what you can buy. We'll show you how.

programme.title: Freedom from Red Sauce
programme.desc: Tomatoes and pasta are a classic (and delicious) pairing, but sometimes you want a change. Vegetable sauces, like the two featured in this episode-one with mushrooms and one with broccoli rabe-are appealing options.

programme.title: Quicker Pasta
programme.desc: Sure, raw tomato sauces are fast, but if the sauce is watery and bland, who cares? Likewise, asparagus-based pasta sauces are often bland and boring. In this episode we keep things simple while avoiding these common problems.

programme.title: Winter Supper
programme.desc: Osso buco, literally "bone with a hole,'' is the Italian term for veal shanks. This meaty cut, akin to beef shanks or lamb shanks, becomes meltingly tender when stewed for several hours in a covered pot. Our goal was to create a recipe that guaranteed perfectly tender meat with rich flavor. We serve it with a simple and satisfying polenta.

programme.title: Pulled Pork and Cornbread
programme.desc: We wanted to develop a recipe for pulled pork that rivals that of the best barbecue joints but won't be an all-day affair. We pair the pork with another barbecue classic-cornbread.

programme.title: Indian and Thai Curries
programme.desc: In this episode, we prepare an Indian-inspired shrimp curry and a Thai-inspired green curry with chicken.

programme.title: Meatloaf Dinner
programme.desc: Meatloaf made with all beef requires some special handling so that it doesn't taste like a dry, loaf-shaped hamburger. We set out to make a loaf with well-seasoned meat and just enough binder to give the loaf a tender, not tough, texture. In choosing a side dish to partner with our meatloaf, we turned to another old-fashioned dish-skillet-roasted potatoes.

programme.title: What's For Dinner? Stir-fry Tofu with Spicy Basil Tomatoes
programme.desc: Ken and Mary Jo have a fun time in the kitchen cooking a stir-fry tofu with spicy basil tomatoes, plus a few other excellent dishes.

programme.title: A Taste of History - The Santa Fe Trail
programme.desc: Chef Staib journeys down the Santa Fe trail through Kansas to discover where travelers regrouped before the next perilous leg of their journey. Recipes like steamed venison pudding and bison stew are prepared at a local stagecoach stop.

programme.title: Chefs A' Field: Green Cuisine - The Real Chefs Garden
programme.desc: In this episode we experience Seattle’s most pure, organic, direct and delicious “Farm to Table” experience with Chef Brian Scheehser. He practices sustainable farming in his own three‐acre garden, with the hand of a farmer and the meticulous nature of a chef. Part Chef‐Part Farmer, Scheehser offers expert tips on cooking and insight on how to grow your garden.

programme.title: Kimchi Chronicles - The Rice Chronicles
programme.desc: Rice, the bread and butter of the Korean table is explored from Busan, Korea’s second largest city, all the way to Seoul. Along the way, Marja and her dear friend, the actress Heather Graham, learn about instant rice, tteok (a pasta-like ingredient made of ground rice) and visit Bibigo, a new chain of contemporary restaurants serving fresh variations of bibimbap.

programme.title: Great Chefs of America: Jean-Claude Poilevey, David Machado, and Norman Love
programme.desc: Recipes included with this episode: Lyonnaise Salad, Halibut Cheeks with Potatoes and Artichoke, and Banana-Chocolate Tart with Malted Milk Ice Cream. Restaurants include: Le Bouchon in Chicago, Pazzo Ristorante in Portland, and The Ritz-Carlton in Naples.

programme.title: Hawaii Cooks with Roy Yamaguchi - Oodles of Noodles
programme.desc: A visit to Crown noodle factory in Honolulu reveals the fine art of noodle making. This episode also features a variety of Asian and Italian pasta dishes such as Vietnamese Summer Rolls, Chicken Macadamia Nut Pasta and Roy's Asian Pasta Primavera. Master sommelier Chuck Furuya is on hand to recommend the right wine and pasta combination.

programme.title: Foodie Road Trip with Skye Estroff - Peeling Back the Layers of Vidalia
programme.desc: Skye takes us back to Vidalia, GA, where she digs into oversized steaks and New York-style Italian food. Learn more about Vidalia's world-renowned sweet onions and the people who make up this south Georgia town.

programme.title: From Scratch - Ruben Sandwich
programme.desc: Today, Chef Joe bakes bread with his mother and daughter and makes the classic Ruben Sandwich.

programme.title: The Kitchen Wisdom of Cecilia Chiang - The Long Walk
programme.desc: In this episode, Cecilia joins Laurence Jossel, chef and owner of Nopa. Like Cecilia, South African-born Jossel came a long way to open a restaurant in San Francisco. Cecilia shows Laurence how to make “beggar’s chicken,” a whole, stuffed chicken wrapped in lotus leaves and then clay, and baked for at least two hours.

programme.title: Nick Stellino: Storyteller in the Kitchen - Beign Italian
programme.desc: Chef Stellino explains the difference between Italians from Italy and Italian Americans. Dishes include: Salsiccie al Sugo (sausages braised in tomato sauce ) / Pasta alla Nanci (with Ricotta cheese) / Pasta with Shrimp (Linguine and Shrimp in white wine) / Sicilian Fish Soup / Pannacotta (chocolate pudding with berries and mint).

programme.title: Ciao Italia - Rice to the Occasion
programme.desc: PBS celebrity Chef Martin Yan joins Mary Ann nella cucina in a salute to rice. With knives chopping and veggies sizzling, Martin creates one of his signature dishes, Mint Flavored Rice with Chicken while Mary Ann turns down the flame for Milanese Risotto. Then together they create a Rice and Vegetable Pie. Two great chefs, three great rice recipes and you’ll agree that Mary Yan Can Cook!

programme.title: Martin Yan's Chinatowns - The Spice Garden
programme.desc: Singapore was once a major seaport during the height of the spice trade. Martin picks spices from the garden of his friend Kwan Liu who has a cooking school here. They use the spices to prepare dishes with the fresh ingredients they found at the Tiong Bahru Market. This episode's recipes include: Double-Ginger Fish, Egg-Flower Soup with Lemongrass and Mushrooms, and Fluffy Cloud in Lime Syrup.

programme.title: Primal Grill - Burn In The USA
programme.desc: People grill all over Planet Barbeque but Steven believes no one does it better than in America. Recipes include: Martha's Vineyard Lobster, Texas Clod and Spit-roasted Pork.

programme.title: Michael Chiarello's Napa - Zuppe, Zuppe, Zupp
programme.desc: Soup makes a meal and, with a few techniques, becomes a sauce the next day for fish, poultry or meat. Summer Corn Soup, served warm or cold, makes a beautiful yellow sauce for scallops. Tart apples and sweet butternut squash make a soup that becomes a full-bodied sauce for pork chops. We'll visit a ghost winery and meet some third-generation California winemakers.

programme.title: Lidia's Italian Table - Two Italian-American Classics
programme.desc: Filet mignon and chocolate – these don’t sound like ingredients to top off a list of Italian-American recipes – but in the kitchen of Lidia Bastianich, it’s “Tutti a tavola” to cook and savor two of our most sensual foods: Seared Filet Mignon with Italian style chunky braised vegetables, followed by a rich Hazelnut-Chocolate Ice Cream Truffle.

programme.title: Infusion - Fish
programme.desc: Today on Infusion, we look at the various way fish are used in cooking.

programme.title: Julia & Jacques Cooking at Home - Eggs
programme.desc: Eggs: all sizes, all types from chicken to quail to ostrich… soft, scrambled, poached… from omelets to Frittatas to eggs Benedict…not to mention Julia and Jacques scrambling an ostrich egg as voluminous as a dozen and a half Grade A Large.

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | HVAC of the Future
programme.desc: Jeff shows Kevin how he’s framing the net zero house. Richard demonstrates heat loss and gain to design a balanced HVAC system. He and Don visit the International Builders Show. Now that the house is open, Kevin can see the old wiring and plumbing.

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | A Charleston Family House is Reborn
programme.desc: New apprentices join the team in Rhode Island as the roof goes up. The homeowners visit a cabinet showroom to finalize their plans. The house gets sheathed. It’s the finish line at Judith’s house in Charleston. Kevin and Tom take the grand tour.

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | Ramp Up the R Value
programme.desc: Insulation is crucial to a net zero house. Kevin finds Jeff and the apprentices starting the work. Dana shops for efficient yet decorative lighting. Tom and Jeff work with the apprentices to build false rafter tails and then they install them.

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | Net-Zero Blanket
programme.desc: Roof insulation is next step at the net zero house. Richard tours the basement of The Breakers in Newport. Kevin meets Congressman Norcross at the house, who is also an electrician. Apprentices install and flash windows.

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | Modern Barn Raising
programme.desc: The electrician installs a load center at the Idea House. Tom teaches the apprentices the correct application of cedar roof shingles. Kevin and Jeff add insulation to the basement. Tom shows Mary how to block behind walls with future cabinets and wall fixtures. A pre-cut post and beam barn gets raised.

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | Airtight House
programme.desc: Richard watches as the home is sealed against air leaks. Jeff reviews his pre-drywall checklist. Kevin sees the landscape plan. Jeff fabricates pieces for porch columns and rails. Tommy puts on shingles as the final layer of the exterior wall system

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | Designing Their Dream Home
programme.desc: Dana and Don show Kevin interior design choices at their architecture studio. Richard demonstrates how a heat pump works. Mark watches as stone veneer is applied at the Idea House. The plumber installs a wall hung toilet tank inside the wall. Don builds his powder room vanity with Tom.

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | Powering Net Zero
programme.desc: Tom discusses the differences between hanging blue board and hanging drywall. Richard learns about the process to size a solar array. Jeff and Tommy install a wood ceiling. The electrician puts in a generator at the Idea House. Richard visits a Newport boat building school.

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | Roger's Nod to Sod
programme.desc: Roger visits a nearby sod farm with Jenn and Kevin. Richard inspects the HVAC installation. A gas fireplace goes in the living room. Tom and Jeff attach screens on the side porch. Outside, a new well is dug to provide water for the landscaping.

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | Energy-saving Installations
programme.desc: Kevin learns about induction cooking. Richard watches as the solar panels go on the barn roof. Outside, Jeff installs a unique lattice designed by Don. Richard demonstrates how an ERV works. Jenn finds the landscaping and hardscaping is well underway.

programme.title: The Jamestown Net-Zero House | Net Zero Comes Together
programme.desc: The Net Zero house is complete. Kevin and Tom discuss challenges with Jeff. Don gives Kevin a tour of the yard and barn. Dana shows Tom the upstairs. He checks out the main floor with Don. Richard reviews mechanicals. All gather in the transformed kitchen at the end.

programme.title: Brookline Mid-century Modern House | Mid-century Modern Makeover
programme.desc: Tommy and Kevin cruise around Brookline, MA in a ’57 Chevy before rolling up to the latest project: a lackluster 1957 mid-century modern house in need of a total overhaul. They learn about the full scope of work, and Charlie starts in on demo.

programme.title: Brookline Mid-century Modern House | Next-generation Demolition
programme.desc: While old fixtures are salvaged and asbestos is removed at the house, Norm, Richard and Kevin head back to where it all began 40 years ago, in Dorchester, MA. Later, Roger starts to remove a tree that’s threatening the property.

programme.title: Brookline Mid-century Modern House | Apprentices in Sill School
programme.desc: Norm teaches the apprentices how to lay a sill on the new foundation, while Richard scopes the sewer to see what might be lurking inside. Kevin, the homeowners and their designer start in on a plan to create a sleek, modern space

programme.title: Brookline Mid-century Modern House | Beam Me Up, Tommy
programme.desc: The foundation of the house has no footings, so Mark McCullough pours a buttress. Kevin visits the 2001 Manchester by the Sea project. Back at the house, Richard solves a ductwork puzzle while Kevin and Tommy install a PVC trim overhang.

programme.title: Brookline Mid-century Modern House | Norm Revisits a Skylight
programme.desc: Kevin meets electrician Heath Eastman to learn about in-counter outlets. Tommy visits former apprentice Nathan Gilbert to see what he’s been up to over the past year. Back at the house, Norm teaches Carly how to frame a skylight.

programme.title: Concord Country Cape | Solid Foundation
programme.desc: The foundation is waterproofed. Exterior paint colors are discussed. Homeowner Megan lends a hand turning the new newel posts. Cape style homes are discussed. The foundation is braced for backfilling.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 4, 10 Chefs Compete" - The ten remaining chefs must please a picky teen who has come to Hell's Kitchen for her birthday party. The team that designs the best menu wins a teen-themed treat.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 4, 8 Chefs Compete" - Chef Ramsay asks for a volunteer to switch sides. The group dynamic changes as the teams face their next challenge: creating four dishes using twenty specific ingredients.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 4, 7 Chefs Compete" - In the opening challenge, the two teams compete in a relay race. The winners earn surfing lessons while the losers must clean Hell's Kitchen from top to bottom.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Sante Le Brea
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay travels to LA to inspect Sante La Brea. He discovers a financially strapped owner who isn't respected by his staff. And an incident that occurs in the eatery leads to a police visit.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Lido di Manhattan
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Lido di Manhattan, an Italian joint with an unsightly kitchen and inexperienced owner. He is so horrified that he shuts the place down temporarily.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Capri
programme.desc: While visiting the Eagle Rock area of Los Angeles, Chef Ramsay stops by Capri. This Italian restaurant is filthy, serves terrible food and is in disarray all thanks to a lazy set of twins.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Luigi's
programme.desc: In Anaheim, California, Chef Ramsay performs an extreme makeover on Luigi's. The Italian eatery faces management conflicts after the owner retires and leaves the business to his sons.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Charlie's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay pays Charlie's a visit. Located in La Verne, California, this Italian eatery suffers from a lackluster menu and outdated décor.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Nino's Italian Restaurant
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay travels to Long Beach, California to visit Nino's Italian Restaurant, where ownership has changed hands from a pleasant immigrant couple to their obnoxious son.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Revisited No. 5
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay returns to Lido di Manhattan, Anna Vincenzo's and Le Bistro to see if the owners have implemented his changes.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Pantaleone's
programme.desc: A Denver restaurant owner maintains that his pizza is the best in the city, but local residents actually prefer store-bought pies.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Mangia Mangia (Part One)
programme.desc: An Italian restaurant in Woodland Park, Colorado is beset with problems, including an incompetent head chef and low morale among the staff.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Mangia Mangia (Part Two)
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay suggests a few top-down changes to help Mangia Mangia survive.

programme.title: Verdad Oculta: Episodio 41
programme.desc: Después de la caída de un infame narco-líder, el coronel Diana está lista para tomarse un descanso de la policía y trabajar para arreglar su matrimonio. Su jefe, sin embargo, tiene otros planes y le asigna al coronel Diana su mayor misión hasta la fecha: desmantelar "el Clan del Norte" dirigido por los hermanos Zurria y sus aliados oficiales corruptos y funcionarios del gobierno.

programme.title: Víctimas Del Divorcio
programme.desc: Cuando tres es multitud.

programme.title: Jodha Akbar
programme.desc: Jodha Akbar es un drama épico ambientado en el siglo XVI que relata la historia sobre un matrimonio político de conveniencia entre un emperador mogol, Akbar y una princesa Rajput, Jodha Bai. La trama se centra en cómo éste matrimonio político trae el amor entre ellos en una medida que cambió el destino de la India, así mismo retrata las guerras de ese tiempo junto con las relaciones entre los mogoles y los Rajputs. Gran parte de la historia recrea el funcionamiento de las instituciones icónicas de la época como las reinas, los tribunales, las cortesanas, los ministros y su influencia en la historia de amor de Akbar y Jodha Bai. La serie también destaca cómo el Emperador Mogol Jalaluddin adquiere el título de Akbar del pueblo.

programme.title: Me Caíste Del Cielo
programme.desc: Una tragi-comedia en la que un hombre rescata al dueño de una taquería, quien se encuentra en inminente riesgo

programme.title: Agua en la Boca
programme.desc: Es una historia de amor prohibido entre dos jóvenes, hijos de familias rivales. La hermosa Danielle Cassoulet (de descendencia francés) y el aventurero Luca Bellini (de descendencia italiana). El conflicto entre el cassoulet y la familia Bellini es viejo, siendo antes los mejores amigos de la juventud las matriarcas de esas familias hoy no pueden permanecer de pie debido a una disputa amorosa en el pasado en el que Françoise Cassoulet, y la abuela de Dany se peleaban por el amor de un mismo hombre.

programme.title: El Mono
programme.desc: A dos medio hermanas la vida les dará un giro radical luego de evento dramático.

programme.title: El Talisman
programme.desc: Tras perder un rancho en Texas, Camila Nájera y su familia se mudan a Fresno, California. El destino los llevará a ser vecinos del despiadado Gregorio Negrete, dueño del rancho "El Alcatraz". Gregorio ha vivido en guerra con Los Aceves, antiguos dueños de "El Talismán", y su único sueño es poseer ese rancho. Camila se verá envuelta en este juego de ambición y poder, que la lleva a conocer a dos hombres que le cambiarán la vida.

programme.title: Víctimas Del Divorcio
programme.desc: Cuando tres es multitud.

programme.title: Cada Noche Un Amor
programme.desc: Isabel cae en las redes de unos traficantes de mujeres. En un barco conoce a un joven francés del que se enamora, pero su amor sera imposible.

programme.title: Juan Colorado
programme.desc: Una trágica historia de amor durante la Revolución Mexicana. Juan Lorenzo y su padre son víctimas de una emboscada. El padre muere, ¿y Juan Lorenzo?

programme.title: El Circo De Capulina
programme.desc: Capulina ayuda al dueño de un circo a levantar la carpa con sus elefantes. Participa en todos los actos logrando que el circo se salve de la ruina.

programme.title: Muchacho
programme.desc: Un joven isleño vive con su abuela en el Tigre. A la isla vecina llega, para pasar sus vacaciones, una atractiva millonaria. Los dos se enamoran, pero el padre se opone.

programme.title: Vagabundo Y Millonario
programme.desc: Un millonario, importante hombre de negocios, es secuestrado. Por coincidencia Tin-Tan comete una pequeña infracción y es detenido por la policía.

programme.title: Struggle Meals en español
programme.desc: Frankie nos enseña cómo usar verduras enteras, desde la raíz hasta el tallo, lo que significa que ningún alimento se desperdicia.

programme.title: Make this tonight en español
programme.desc: La chef Bricia nos lleva atrás en el tiempo a su infancia en Oaxaca, México, para probar la comida característica de su madre. Nada dice amor como una comida casera de mamá.

programme.title: Make this tonight en español
programme.desc: El chef Jason Neroni tiene la habilidad de trabajar con ingredientes cotidianos de formas inesperadas.

programme.title: Make this tonight en español
programme.desc: La cocina mexicana es decididamente la favorita en la casa de los Ryan. Y cuando se trata de alimentar a un grupo grande, la chef Daisy Ryan tiene el mejor menú planeado para ti.

programme.title: El toque de Aquiles
programme.desc: Aquiles Chávez celebra al norte de México con una deliciosa discada.

programme.title: El toque de Aquiles
programme.desc: Día de sopas, esta vez el chef Aquiles prepara dos sopas clásicas: sopa de tortilla y sopa de fideos secos.

programme.title: El toque de Aquiles
programme.desc: Bienvenido a lo mejor de la cocina francesa, vamos a preparar Bœuf bourguignon, o sea res con vino tinto.

programme.title: El toque de Aquiles
programme.desc: Vamos a darnos gusto con los frutos del mar: Camarones al coco y Pulpo al ajillo.

programme.title: Tacos con todo
programme.desc: Fran, taquero de profesión, nos enseña a preparar taquitos para los días de resaca: tacos de birria, acompañados con salsa de chile de árbol y agua de limón con pepino.

programme.title: Tacos con todo
programme.desc: Fran nos presenta un taco con mucha historia, los tacos de cochinita, originario de la península de Yucatán.

programme.title: Comidas económicas

programme.title: I'M LIVE: S1 E178
programme.desc: Joining us on this week's I'm LIVE are the beloved monkies of the Korean music industry - JANNABI! JANNABI is an old-fashioned Korean word for “monkey,” and this band made their debut in 2014 with the digital single, "Rocket." Since then, they have impressed numerous listeners with their retro-infused music that portrays various stories of the youth, ranging from love to separation to frustration. Last year, the band released their second full-length album, "Legend," and topped all the music charts with the album's lead track "for lovers who hesitate." Before releasing their third full-length album next year, the band dropped a new mini-album just a week ago, and this time as a duo, to nourish listeners' hearts. In this episode, JANNABI performs both their latest tracks and hit songs - "A thought on an autumn night," "Old dog," "Sweet memories," and "Step" from their new album, "JANNABI's Small Pieces 1," as well as "Summer," and "for lovers who hesitate." Tune in to I'm LIVE this week and enjoy a beautiful autumn day with these talented musicians!

programme.title: Jason Hewlett - Father Time
programme.desc: The Award-Winning One-Man Show of Jason Hewlett The Entertainer will have you laughing until it hurts. Comedy, Music, Impressions, and Standing Ovations make Jason the perfect entertainer. His brand of Hilarious G-Rated Entertainment is unlike anything you have ever enjoyed. Over 2,000 shows for more than 1 Million audience members in his incredible career make Jasonís show an event you will remember for years to come.

programme.title: Matt Falk - Un-Lit
programme.desc: Matt Falk was called “effortlessly funny” by the CBC. He’s performed at Just For Laughs, The Hal!fax Comedy Festival and the Winnipeg Comedy Festival. He was recently named one of the “Best of the Fest” at the Burbank Comedy Festival in California.

programme.title: Jeff Allen - I Can Laugh About it Now
programme.desc: Jeff Allen combines clean, hilarious humor like no other comedian working today. Besides performing at corporate functions and fundraisers, he regularly appears on television, radio, and casinos across the country. Consistently making heroes out of meeting planners, Jeff Allen provides world-class comedy.

programme.title: Billy Anderson - America's Sweetheart
programme.desc: Born in Texas and raised in Augusta, Georgia ñ Billy Anderson is stand-up comedian currently living in Seattle, Washington. Heís been seen regionally at SketchFest Seattle, The Washington Comedy Festival, Bumbershoot and was a finalist in the 2016 Seattle International Comedy Competition. Outside of the Northwest, Billy has written for Cracked.Com, performed in SF Sketchfest, LaLaFest Los Angeles, the San Francisco International Comedy Competition and as of 2013 he has performed stand-up comedy in every US state. Billy was recently featured on Audibleís ìSounds Like Americaî hosted by Jackie Kashian and the syndicated program ìLaughsî on Fox television.

programme.title: Marc Yaffee - Mid-Laugh Crisis
programme.desc: Adopted at birth and confused ever since, Marc takes his audiences on a comedy joyride as he explores his multi-ethnic roots and the culture clashes that fill his world. Marc’s smart but relatable comedy demonstrates a universal appeal that has landed him appearances on PBS, Comics Unleashed, The Latino Laugh Festival and the Showtime special, Goin’ Native. Funny not filthy, Marc serves audiences his original comedy recipe, specially prepared for non- stop laughs. Tasty topics, spicy premises and savory punchlines, are all dished out with a dash of sarcasm and a grain of salt. A regular in Las Vegas, Marc has performed six times overseas for Armed Forces Entertainment and he’s a past winner of Ventura Comedy Festival’s Funniest Person Contest.

programme.title: Dave Burleigh - Nobody's Keeping You Here
programme.desc: Comedian and Impressionist Dave Burleigh's star is on the rise. His uncanny ability to impersonate just about anyone landed him the starring role as Charlie Sheen in "Not Another Celebrity Movie." Burleigh's multiple characters, voices, and impressions were showcased on Season 7 of America's Got Talent, where he became a fast favorite of both judges and fans alike. Judge Howard Stern said, "You have an excellent command of the stage." Fellow comedian and judge Howie Mandel added, "Your impressions were spot on." Burleigh's laid back and easy going style and persona on stage contrasted with his unique facial and body expressions are guaranteed to leave audiences amazed and impressed. As a two-time finalist in the San Francisco Comedy Competition, Burleigh now shares the first runner-up spot with past participant comedy legends like Robin Williams, Ellen DeGeneres, Marc Maron, Dane Cook and Kevin Pollak. With numerous television, podcast and radio appearances, prestigious publications like Rolling Stone are talking, "Burleigh has the trappings of a soon to be comedy star!" This talented, singer, musician, actor, comedian and host tours the world over 36 weeks a year and headlines all the major casinos in Las Vegas. Make sure to catch Dave's show at a theater or comedy club near you, as he will no doubt, leave you with a lasting impression.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Josh Blue - The Disabled List
programme.desc: Following his groundbreaking win on NBC’s Last Comic Standing in 2006, Josh Blue has risen through the ranks to become a well-established headliner at venues throughout the world.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Corey Rodrigues - People Whisperer
programme.desc: Corey is a highly sought after national touring college, club and corporate and cruise ship performer. He was the winner of The Catch a New Rising Star, The Funniest Comic in New England and the 2017 Big Sky Comedy Festivals. Rodrigues has been featured on the hilarious Gotham Live, Laughs on Fox and True Tv's Laff Mobbs Laff Tracks television shows and currently can be heard on Sirius XM. He combines comedy from his own life and the lives of those around him. Mix that with a hilarious point of view and he's able to talk about just about anything.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Maija DiGiorgio - Maija Pinion
programme.desc: Born to a black mother and an Italian father in New York City, Maija Digiorgios comedy centers on the examination of her own mixed-race identity. Digiorgio riffs on Thanksgiving with each side of her family, gender roles between the two cultlures, and her racist grandma in this special.

programme.title: Alex Velluto - Spurious
programme.desc: Like Rocky Balboa, Alex Velluto is the son of an Italian immigrant and brings the same intensity, will, and drive to the comedy stage. In 2016, Alex was voted 'Best Comedian' by City Weekly Magazine and is the winner of the Finger Lakes Comedy Festival in Ithaca, NY. Alex is a regular at Wiseguys Comedy Club where he has headlined and worked with some of the biggest names in comedy. He has also “gone the distance” in many competitions and festivals across the country. Alex was a finalist in the the Funniest Person in Utah competition, and The Salt Lake Comedy Festival stand up competition, has performed at the Idaho Laugh Festival, and Finger Lakes Comedy Festival. In addition to his stand-up comedy, Alex is a co-host of the "Happy Valley Podcast", and is renowned for referring to himself in the third person, and is an excellent writer of comedy bios about himself that everybody likes.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Brad Trackman - Thanks
programme.desc: Brad Trackman is a national touring comedian who has been featured on a number of well-known comedy shows and channels.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Orlando Baxter - Glorified Baby Sitter
programme.desc: Orlando Baxter's fresh perspective and unique relatability makes this former high school teacher a fan favorite all over the world. In 2016, Orlando made his late night TV debut on the Conan show on TBS, and since then he's appeared on the television shows "Comedy Up Late" in Australia, B.E.T.'s "50 Central" and Laff Mobb's Laff Track on Tru TV.

programme.title: Don Barnhart - The Spinal Disintegration of Man
programme.desc: Don’s ability to keep audiences of all ages howling with laughter and coming back for more is what separates him from the average joke teller.

programme.title: RiffTrax: Blood Theater
programme.desc: Every time the Blood Theatre has opened for business, someone has died. But this time, the most incompetent theater owner in town has a good feeling about his chances! This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of MST3K).

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Families: Earning And Spending
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic riffing treatment to the educational short Families: Earning And Spending! Join Mike, Kevin and Bill and spend a little well-earned time with Families: Earning and Spending!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX LIVE - Space Mutiny
programme.desc: Space Mutiny! The very title conjures up many memories: tiny cars, writhing spandex-witches, deadly railings. Oh, and we guess there's a mutiny in there somewhere...This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of MST3K).

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - The Tale of Moose Baby
programme.desc: RiffTrax, the guys who make movies funny, bring their comedic riffing treatment to this short about Moose Baby! "But what is it about?" you quite reasonably ask. It is not about anything. It is Moose Baby. Join Mike, Kevin, and Bill for The Tale of Moose Baby!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX PRESENTS - The Amazing Mr. X
programme.desc: Ravens, crystal balls, cocktails and ….MURDER! Join Bridget and Mary Jo as they riff The Amazing Mr. X.

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Flying Stewardess
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic riffing treatment to the short Flying Stewardess! Hop aboard and join Mike, Kevin and Bill for Flying Stewardess!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX - Pressure Point
programme.desc: Sebastian Dellacourt is leading a double life: he tells his wife that he’s a humble systems analyst. But he’s actually a D-list actor starring in films by the director of Time Chasers and Radical Jack! This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of MST3K).

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - The Value of Teamwork
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic riffing treatment to this short about a talking dog teaching his young master all about The Value of Teamwork. Be a team player and join Mike, Kevin, and Bill for this hilarious riff!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX - Superargo And The Faceless Giants
programme.desc: Join former MST3K stars Mike, Kevin, and Bill and have a blast with the meandering, low-impact heroics of Superargo and the Faceless Giants! This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (former stars of Mystery Science Theater 3000 aka MST3K).
